newsitem.title: USA: Enron in wind energy deal with MidAmerican.
newsitem.headline: Enron in wind energy deal with MidAmerican.

text.p: Enron Corp's Enron Renewable Energy Corp unit has signed a contract to supply 112.5 megawatts of wind-generated electricity to the MidAmerican electrical grid, Enron said in a statement.
"The power purchase agreement is the single largest purchase contract in the history of wind energy," said Enron, although it gave no revenue figures for the deal.
MidAmerican, which has 642,000 electric customers and 610,000 natural gas customers, will buy the output from a plant that Enron Renewable's Zond subsidiary will construct in northwestern Iowa.
The project will provide electricity to power approximately 50,000 homes, Enron said. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
